title: GRAPH DATABASES: NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR CONNECTED DATA
description: Author: Ian Robinson, Jim Webber, Emil Eifrem Edition: 2 edition Publication Date: July 9, 2015 Publisher: O`Reilly Media ISBN-10: 1491930896 ISBN-13: 978-1491930892 Pages: 238 pages Format: pdf Size: 12M --- Discover how graph databases can help you manage and query highly connected data. With this practical book, youll learn how to design and implement a graph database that brings the power of graphs to bear on a broad range of problem domains. Whether you want to speed up your response to user queries or build a database that can adapt as your business evolves, this book shows you how to apply the schema-free graph model to real-world problems. This second edition includes new code samples and diagrams, using the latest Neo4j syntax, as well as information on new functionality. Learn how different organizations are using graph databases to outperform their competitors. --- http://dlfeb.com/book/graph-databases-new-opportunities-for-connected-data/
